data.meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).
data.sentence: The word الْكُبْرَى comes from the root ك ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To be hard, become hard, be grievous, grow up, be great. Kabira/Yakburu: To be exceed anyone in age, become stout and tall, grow big, become great, illustrious, become momentous (affair).

data.meanings: to come/do, commit, (with preposition bi) to bring, produce, (2:275) to receive
data.sentence: The word جَاءَتِ comes from the root ج ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to come/do, commit, (with preposition bi) to bring, produce, (2:275) to receive

data.meanings: to cover up, overflow, overwhelm, swallow up, fill to the brim. taammatun - calamity, overwhelming event.
data.sentence: The word الطَّامَّةُ comes from the root ط م م and is associated with the meanings: to cover up, overflow, overwhelm, swallow up, fill to the brim. taammatun - calamity, overwhelming event.
